citations.narrative:
The registrant on multiple occasions took dogs out of their transport enclosure during transport.
In a video posted to social media dated March 15 2023 she has a male French bulldog out of his transport enclosure.
In a video posted to social media dated April 7, 2023 she has a female French bulldog out of her transport enclosure.
USDA Officials showed the registrant these social media posts and she confirmed that these were her.
Taking a dog out of its transport enclosure during transit can result in injury to the animal or its escape. The regulations
state that removal during transportation in commerce is prohibited. Except during the cleaning of the primary enclosures,
as required in 3.15(b), during transportation in commerce a dog must not be removed from its primary enclosure, unless it
is placed in another primary enclosure or facility that meets the requirements of 3.6 or 3.15.
Correct by December 29, 2023

The registrant on multiple occasions took exotic animals out of their transport enclosure during transport.
In a video posted to social media dated June 9, 2023 she has a male caracal kitten out of his transport enclosure.
In a video posted to social media dated June 20, 2023 she has a coatimundi out of its transport enclosure.
USDA Officials showed the registrant these social media posts and she confirmed that these were her.
Taking a dangerous or wild animals out of its transport enclosure during transit can result in injury to the animal or its
escape. During the course of transportation, in commerce, live animals shall not be removed from their primary
enclosures unless places in other primary enclosures or facilities conforming to the requirements provided in this subpart.
Correct by December 29, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n
